example: I join the singing |contest| at school.
example_translation: 学校の歌のコンテストに参加します。

json.pronunciation: [US](動) kəntést (名) kɑ́ntèst [UK](動) kəntést (名) kɔ́ntest

other_examples.english: I entered the poetry |contest| at the library.
other_examples.translation: 私は図書館の詩のコンクールに参加した。

phrases.translation: コンテストに出場[参加]する
コンテストを開催する

json.english_meaning: A situation where two or more people or groups try to win or achieve something by competing against each other.

example: This is the |front| of my house.
example_translation: こちらは私の家の正面です。

synonyms.description: 「front」と「facade」は共に「正面」という意味を持つが、前者は物理的な位置や方向を指し、後者は特に建物の外観や装飾的な側面を強調する。

json.english_meaning: A position or surface that faces forward or is most visible, often considered the main or most important side of something.

example_translation: 彼らはミーティングで情報を交換した。

derivatives.translation: 有益な情報を提供する

synonyms.description: 「information」と「data」は共に「情報」という意味を持つが、前者は整理されて意味を持つ知識や内容を指し、後者は未処理の生の数値や事実を指す。

json.english_meaning: Details or facts that help you understand a situation, person, or event.

example_translation: 今日はサーフィンをしたい。

other_examples.english: I love to |surf| on weekends.
other_examples.translation: 週末にサーフィンをするのが大好きです。

phrases.translation: サーフィンをしに行く

json.english_meaning: To ride on waves using a special board, usually at the beach.

example_translation: クッキーを焼いてください。

json.english_meaning: To cook food in an oven with dry heat, making it firm or solid.

example_translation: うっかり携帯電話を落としてしまったんだ。

other_examples.english: I |dropped| my wallet while running to the bus.
other_examples.translation: バスに向かって走っているときに財布を落としてしまった。

phrases.translation: ヒントを与える, ほのめかす

json.english_meaning: To let go of something you are holding so that it falls to the ground; to make something fall suddenly; to lower something to a lower position; to stop doing or discussing something; to reduce the amount or level of something.

example: I had so much |fun| at the party.
example_translation: パーティーはとても楽しかった。

phrases.translation: 楽しむ, エンジョイする

synonyms.description: 「fun」と「pleasure」は共に「楽しみ」という意味を持つが、前者は主に遊びや娯楽に関連し、軽快でカジュアルな楽しさを表すのに対し、後者はより深い満足感や喜びを伴う経験を指すことが多い。

json.english_meaning: An enjoyable and exciting experience or activity that brings happiness and amusement. It can also refer to behavior that is lighthearted and shows joy.

example: I would watch a popular |program| tonight.
example_translation: 今夜は人気の番組を見るんだ。

other_examples.english: He enjoys watching a documentary |program| about nature.
other_examples.translation: 彼は自然に関するドキュメンタリー番組を見るのが好きです。

synonyms.description: 「program」と「show」は共に「番組」という意味を持つが、前者は特定の内容やテーマに基づいた放送やイベントを指し、後者は視覚的に提示されるエンターテイメントやパフォーマンスを強調する傾向がある。

json.english_meaning: A planned series of events or activities, often broadcast on television or radio, designed to entertain or inform an audience.

example: She is a |volunteer| at the hospital.
example_translation: 彼女は病院でボランティアをしている。

derivatives.translation: 不本意な, 無意識の

phrases.translation: 進んで〜しようと申し出る
ボランティアとして自分の時間を割く[奉仕する]

json.english_meaning: A person who helps or does a job without getting paid, often out of kindness or a desire to assist others.

example_translation: ボートに乗るのが好きなんだ。

json.english_meaning: A vehicle that moves on water, often used to carry people.

example_translation: その会社の業績は好調だ。

synonyms.description: 「company」と「office」は共に「会社」という意味を持つが、前者は法人やビジネスの組織全体を指し、後者はその組織内の特定の場所や部門を指す。

json.english_meaning: A business organization that produces or sells goods or services to earn money, as well as a group of people who are together for a specific purpose or for social reasons, including friends or visitors.

example: Students are working in |groups| of five.
example_translation: 生徒たちは5人ずつのグループで活動している。

synonyms.description: 「group」と「bunch」は共に「グループ」という意味を持つが、前者は人や物の集合体を指し、より正式で広範な使い方がされるのに対し、後者は特に小さな物や人の集まりを指し、カジュアルで親しみやすいニュアンスを持つ。

json.english_meaning: A collection of people or things that are together in one place or connected in some way, often organized for a specific purpose or activity.

example_translation: 友達がかわいい子犬を飼っているんだ。

json.english_meaning: A young dog that is usually playful and friendly.

example: Mothers |worry| when their kids grab knives.
example_translation: 子供が刃物を持つと母親は心配する。

other_examples.english: She |worries| about her health every day.
other_examples.translation: 彼女は毎日自分の健康を心配している。

antonyms.translation: 落ち着かせる, 静める
和らげる, なだめる

json.english_meaning: To feel anxious or unhappy about someone or something, often thinking about them a lot; to cause someone to feel anxious; to trouble or disturb someone.

example_translation: これはイングランドの国旗だ。

other_examples.english: The capital of |England| is London.
other_examples.translation: イングランドの首都はロンドンです。

json.english_meaning: A region in the United Kingdom, known for its capital city, London, and is the largest part of Britain.

example_translation: あなたがこれを気に入ってくれる事を望みます。

phrases.translation: 〜ということを願いましょう
〜したいと思う, 〜することを望む

synonyms.description: 「hope」と「will」は共に「〜を望む」という意味を持つが、前者は不確実な未来の出来事に対する期待や願望を表し、後者は確実性や意志を持って未来の行動や出来事を示す。

json.english_meaning: To want something to happen and believe that it is possible or likely.

example_translation: 今夜はそこに泊まるつもりだ。

json.english_meaning: To remain in a place instead of going away; to live somewhere for a short period as a visitor or guest.

example_translation: 赤いボタンにそっと触れてください。

other_translations.translation: 触れる[軽くたたく]こと

phrases.translation: 〜に手をつけない, を口にしない
〈人〉の心を動かす[打つ], を感動させる

json.english_meaning: To place your hand or finger on someone or something; to make contact with another object so that there is no space between them; to influence someone's feelings or emotions; to handle or use something; to become involved in a situation or problem; to reach a certain level or amount; to lightly hit or kick a ball; to briefly show an expression on your face; to relate to a specific subject or issue; to shine on something; the action of feeling something with your hand; the sense used to understand how something feels; a small detail that enhances something; a specific way of doing something; the sensation something creates on your skin; to make a short visit or call to someone while being elsewhere.

example: The |center| of the town is busy.
example_translation: 町の中心部は賑わっている。

other_examples.english: There was a large fountain in the |center| of the park.
other_examples.translation: 公園の中央に大きな噴水があった。

phrases.translation: 医療[研究, リハビリ]センター
ショッピング[貿易, 会議, 流通]センター

synonyms.description: 「center」と「hub」は共に「中心」という意味を持つが、前者は物理的な中心や焦点を指すことが多く、後者は活動や交通の中心、またはネットワークの中心としての役割を強調する。

json.english_meaning: A point or area that is equally distant from all sides; the middle part of something.

example: An |example| of office supply is a stapler.
example_translation: 事務用品のー例としてホッチキスがあります。

other_examples.english: A good |example| of teamwork is when everyone helps each other to reach a common goal.
other_examples.translation: チームワークの良い例は、みんなが協力して共通の目標に到達することです。

phrases.translation: 好[典型的な, 代表的な, 最上の]例

synonyms.description: 「example」と「instance」は共に「例」という意味を持つが、前者は一般的な説明や概念を示すための具体的な例を指し、後者は特定の状況やケースを指すことが多い。

json.english_meaning: A specific fact, idea, person, or thing that helps to explain or support a general idea, or shows what is typical of a larger group.

example: We had a |meeting| to discuss plans.
example_translation: 私たちはプランの打ち合わせのために会議をした。

synonyms.description: 「meeting」と「conference」は共に「会議」という意味を持つが、前者は通常、少人数での非公式な集まりを指し、後者は大規模で公式な集まりやイベントを指すことが多い。

json.english_meaning: A gathering of people to talk about and make decisions on specific topics.

example_translation: 夜、星は明るく輝く。

phrases.translation: ショーの最高の演技者

json.english_meaning: A bright point of light in the night sky, which is a large ball of burning gas in space. It can also refer to a famous and successful person in entertainment or sports, or someone who plays a main role in a performance. Additionally, it can describe a shape with multiple points that resembles how a star looks in the sky.

example_translation: 近くにいい町がある。

phrases.translation: 町にいて, 町を訪れて

json.english_meaning: A place where people live and work, containing houses, shops, and offices, that is smaller than a city but larger than a village.

example: Please |collect| the toys in the box.
example_translation: 箱の中のおもちゃを集めてください。

other_examples.english: He enjoys |collecting| coins from different countries.
other_examples.translation: 彼は異なる国のコインを集めるのが好きだ。

derivatives.translation: 収集, コレクション
収集家, コレクター

antonyms.translation: 散らす, 分散させる

phrases.translation: 情報[データ, 証拠]を集める
〈人・慈善団体など〉のために〈金品〉の寄付を募る
税金[家賃, 借金]を徴収する

synonyms.description: 「collect」と「assemble」は共に「集める」という意味を持つが、前者はバラバラのものを集めて一つにすることに重点があり、後者は特定の目的のために部品や要素を組み立てることに重点がある。

json.english_meaning: To gather items of the same kind from various locations and bring them together; to accumulate things that you find appealing or interesting; to receive money that is owed to you; to ask for donations for a charitable cause; to gradually increase in amount in a specific place; to arrive at a location to take someone or something; to form a group of people over time.

example_translation: 私の趣味はピアノを弾くことです。

derivatives.translation: 趣味を持つ人, 愛好者

json.english_meaning: An activity that you like to do when you are not working or studying.

example_translation: ペンギンは氷の上をよちよちと歩いた。

other_examples.english: The |penguin| swims gracefully in the ocean.
other_examples.translation: ペンギンは海で優雅に泳ぎます。

json.english_meaning: A large bird that lives in the Antarctic, known for its black and white feathers. It cannot fly but is an excellent swimmer, using its wings to move through the water.

example_translation: 報告書が必要なんだ。

other_examples.english: The teacher asked us to submit a |report| on our favorite book.
other_examples.translation: 先生は私たちに好きな本についての報告書を提出するように頼んだ。

synonyms.description: 「report」と「rundown」は共に「報告」という意味を持つが、前者は公式な文書や口頭での詳細な報告を指し、後者は要点を簡潔にまとめた概要や短い説明を指す。

json.english_meaning: A written or spoken account that provides information about a specific situation or event, often used to inform others about what has occurred or to analyze a particular subject.

example_translation: ビデオはDVDに取り変わられてきている。

phrases.translation: ビデオに録画する, ビデオを制作する

json.english_meaning: A recording of a film, television program, or event, often stored on a tape or in a digital format, that can be played back on a machine. It can also refer to the process of capturing and displaying moving images and sounds.

example_translation: 牛肉は柔らかくジューシーだった。

other_examples.english: We enjoyed a delicious |beef| stew for lunch.
other_examples.translation: 私たちは昼食に美味しい牛肉のシチューを楽しんだ。

json.english_meaning: The flesh of a cow that is used as food.

example_translation: 学校では異文化について教えている。

json.english_meaning: The shared beliefs, customs, and way of life of a group of people, including their art, music, and literature. It also refers to the practices and attitudes that are accepted within a specific society or organization.

example_translation: 急いで、バスが出るわ！

json.english_meaning: To act or move faster than usual, often because time is limited; to cause someone to do something more quickly; to bring someone or something to a location in a quick manner.

example: She |picked| and ate the best apple from the basket.
example_translation: 彼女はカゴから最も良いリンゴを選んで食べた。

other_examples.english: He |picked| a ripe tomato from the garden.
other_examples.translation: 彼は庭から熟したトマトを摘んだ。

antonyms.translation: 拒否する, 却下する

phrases.translation: チームのメンバーを選ぶ
〈場所など〉から〜を取る, 取り出す, 抜き取る

json.english_meaning: To choose someone or something from a group, often because they are the best option; to take a flower, fruit, or nut from a plant or tree; to carefully take something small from a place.

example_translation: 新鮮な空気が必要だ。

other_examples.english: She opened the window to let in some fresh |air|.
other_examples.translation: 彼女は新鮮な空気を入れるために窓を開けた。

phrases.translation: 飛行機での旅行, 空の旅

json.english_meaning: The mixture of gases that surrounds the Earth and is essential for breathing.

example_translation: あなたの本を借りたい。

other_examples.english: Can I |borrow| your laptop for a while?
other_examples.translation: 少しの間、君のノートパソコンを借りてもいい？

antonyms.translation: 一定の, 変わらない
安定した, 変わらない

phrases.translation: 〈人・銀行など〉から借金する
多額の借金[借り入れ]をする
〜から〈考え・言葉など〉を借用する

json.english_meaning: To use something that belongs to someone else with the promise to return it later; to take or copy someone's ideas or words for your own use; to receive money from someone that you need to pay back later.

example_translation: 彼は芸術を通して自分の感情を表現した。

other_examples.english: She found it difficult to |express| her thoughts clearly.
other_examples.translation: 彼女は自分の考えをはっきりと表現するのが難しいと感じた。

antonyms.translation: 隠す, 見えなくする

json.english_meaning: To communicate your thoughts or feelings using words, gestures, or actions; to make a particular feeling known; to represent something in a different form, especially in math; to clearly state or write something.

example_translation: 今日はジョギングをしに行こう。

other_examples.english: He enjoys |jogging| in the morning.
other_examples.translation: 彼は朝にジョギングを楽しんでいる。

json.english_meaning: A form of exercise that involves running at a slow and steady pace.

example_translation: あそこにある物は何ですか？

other_examples.english: I found an interesting |thing| in the old box.
other_examples.translation: 古い箱の中に面白い物を見つけた。

phrases.translation: 正しい[まともな, りっぱな]ことをする
〈人〉の状況を楽に[難しく, 厳しく]する

synonyms.description: 「thing」と「object」は共に「物」という意味を持つが、前者は一般的で抽象的な概念を指し、後者は具体的で物理的な存在を強調する。

json.english_meaning: A general term for an object, idea, action, feeling, or fact that someone thinks about, talks about, or experiences. It can refer to something specific that is not named or something unknown. It is also used in negative statements to mean 'anything' and can describe a person or animal in a sympathetic way.

example_translation: 私はアパートに住んでいる。

other_examples.english: I invited my friends to my |apartment| for dinner.
other_examples.translation: 夕食のために友達を私のアパートに招待した。

json.english_meaning: A place where people live, made up of several rooms, usually located on one floor of a larger building.

example_translation: 彼女は試合で勇気を見せた。

phrases.english: pluck up/screw up/summon up the |courage| (to do something)

synonyms.description: 「courage」と「bravery」は共に「勇気」という意味を持つが、前者は困難や恐怖に直面して行動する内面的な強さを強調し、後者は危険や困難に対して果敢に立ち向かう外面的な行動を強調する。

json.english_meaning: The ability to face fear, pain, or difficult situations with bravery and determination.

example_translation: 未来は可能性に満ちている。

json.english_meaning: A time that comes after the present, when events or actions are expected to occur. It can also refer to what will happen to people or things later on.

example: We celebrated a |member| of our team.
example_translation: 私たちはチームの一員を祝福した。

phrases.translation: クラブ[チーム, 委員会, ギャング]の一員

json.english_meaning: A person or country that is part of a group or organization, or one of a specific type of animals or plants.

example_translation: 少女が誰かを待っている。

json.english_meaning: To stay in one place or not do anything until something else occurs or someone comes. It means expecting or hoping for something that has not yet happened or arrived.

example_translation: 彼らはコートでテニスをした。

phrases.translation: 〈人〉に対して訴訟を起こす, を(裁判に)訴える

json.english_meaning: A place where legal cases are heard and decided, involving a judge and sometimes a jury; also, an area designed for playing sports like tennis; or the residence and working place of a king or queen, along with their family and advisors.

example: I want a |lemon| for my drink.
example_translation: 飲み物にレモンが欲しい。

json.english_meaning: A fruit that has a tough yellow skin and sour juice, often used in drinks and cooking. It is also a pale yellow color.

example_translation: ここは私が愛する場所だ。

synonyms.description: 「place」と「spot」は共に「場所」という意味を持つが、前者は一般的な場所や位置を指し、後者は特定の小さな場所や点を指すことが多い。

json.english_meaning: A specific area or location, such as a point in a room, building, town, or city; a home where someone lives; a spot for sitting or placing items; a position or role in a situation or society; or an opportunity to participate in an activity.

example: I love to eat |popcorn| at movies.
example_translation: 映画でポップコーンを食べるのが大好きなんだ。

json.english_meaning: A type of corn that expands and pops when heated, often enjoyed as a warm snack with salt or sugar.

example_translation: アフリカについて学ぶのは大好きだ。

json.english_meaning: A large land area located south of the Mediterranean Sea and west of Asia and the Indian Ocean.

example: He opened his |eyes| wide with surprise.
example_translation: 彼は驚きで目を見開いた。

other_examples.english: She has beautiful blue |eyes| that shine in the sunlight.
other_examples.translation: 彼女は太陽の光の中で輝く美しい青い目を持っている。

json.english_meaning: One of the two organs in the body that allow you to see. It can also refer to a way of looking at or understanding something. Additionally, it can mean the hole in a needle for threading, a small metal piece used with a hook for fastening, the calm center of a storm, or a dark spot on a potato where a new plant can grow.

translation: ショッピングセンター
example_translation: 昨日、ショッピングモールに行ったんだ。

other_translations.translation: ショッピングモール[センター]

other_examples.english: They enjoyed shopping at the |mall|.
other_examples.translation: 彼らはショッピングセンターで買い物を楽しんだ。

json.english_meaning: A large place with many shops, often covered, where vehicles are not allowed.

example_translation: 今注文をしてもいいですか？。

other_examples.english: I would like to |order| a salad for lunch.
other_examples.translation: 昼食にサラダを注文したいです。

phrases.translation: 注文を取り消す[キャンセルする]

json.english_meaning: To request food, drink, or goods from a restaurant or company.

example_translation: スペインに行きたい。

other_examples.english: |Spain| is known for its beautiful architecture.
other_examples.translation: スペインは美しい建築で知られています。

json.english_meaning: A country located in southwest Europe, bordered by France and Portugal, which includes the Balearic and Canary Islands. Its capital is Madrid, and it has a diverse culture with regions like Catalunya and the Basque Country having their own languages. The country has a population of about 47 million people and is known for its warm, dry summers, making it a popular vacation destination. People from this country are known as Spaniards.

example_translation: 軍は夜明けに攻撃する。

other_examples.english: The soldiers decided to |attack| the enemy's base at night.
other_examples.translation: 兵士たちは夜に敵の基地を攻撃することに決めた。

phrases.translation: 人種差別に根ざした暴力

json.english_meaning: To use violence against someone or something with the intention of causing harm or damage. This can also mean to criticize someone or something strongly.

example_translation: 彼らは野菜を育てている。

antonyms.translation: 減少する, 衰退する

synonyms.description: 「grow」と「nurture」は共に「育てる」という意味を持つが、前者は自然に成長する過程を強調し、後者は意図的に手助けや支援を行うことに焦点を当てている。

json.english_meaning: To increase in size, amount, or number over time; to develop or improve gradually; to cultivate plants or crops so they produce fruit or flowers; to allow hair or nails to become longer by not cutting them.

example_translation: 家の鍵をなくしてしまったんだ。

phrases.translation: 重要な点[問題, 争点]

json.english_meaning: A small piece of metal used to open or close a lock, start a vehicle, or operate a device. It can also refer to buttons on a keyboard, parts of musical instruments, or something that is very important or essential in a situation.

example_translation: 週末はピクニックに行った。

other_examples.english: We decided to have a |picnic| near the lake.
other_examples.translation: 私たちは湖の近くでピクニックをすることに決めた。

json.english_meaning: A meal that you eat outside, usually in a natural setting, where you bring food to enjoy with others.

example_translation: 岩はとても重い。

phrases.translation: むき出しの岩, 露岩

json.english_meaning: A hard substance that makes up the main surface of the Earth, often found in large pieces that stick up from the ground.

example_translation: 彼女は美しいドレスを着ている。

derivatives.translation: ドレッシング, 服装
おしゃれな, きちんとした

phrases.translation: リトルブラックドレス
正装[略服, ふだん着]

json.english_meaning: A type of clothing typically worn by women or girls that covers the upper body and part or all of the legs, often designed for special occasions.

example_translation: 科学者は新たな発見をした。

json.english_meaning: A person who studies or works in the field of science.

example_translation: これはなんの音ですか？

phrases.translation: 音を立てる, 声を上げる
音を立てない, 静かにする

json.english_meaning: A thing that you can hear, which can come from various sources like music, speech, or nature. It can also refer to the quality or loudness of what is being heard.

example_translation: 住所を教えてください。

other_translations.translation: に向かって演説[講演]する

other_examples.english: She lives at the same |address| as her parents.
other_examples.translation: 彼女は両親と同じ住所に住んでいます。

json.english_meaning: The details of the location where a person lives or works, often used for sending letters or packages. It includes the building number, street name, and town.

example_translation: パーティーでカップケーキを食べるのが大好きなんだ。

json.english_meaning: A small, sweet cake that is baked in a cup-shaped container, often topped with frosting.

example: National Foundation Day is a national |holiday|.
example_translation: 建国記念日は国民の祝日です。

phrases.translation: クリスマスシーズン, 年末休暇の時期

json.english_meaning: A time when people do not have to work or go to school, often because it is a special day set by law. It can also refer to a period when someone travels for enjoyment or takes a break from their usual activities.

example_translation: このロボットは毎日キッチンを掃除する。

other_examples.english: |Robots| can help us with many tasks.
other_examples.translation: ロボットは私たちの多くの作業を手伝ってくれます。

derivatives.translation: ロボティクス, ロボット工学

json.english_meaning: A machine that can move and perform tasks like a person, often controlled by a computer.

example_translation: 私は冬にシチューを食べるのが大好きだ。

other_examples.english: I made a delicious vegetable |stew| for dinner last night.
other_examples.translation: 昨晩、夕食においしい野菜シチューを作りました。

json.english_meaning: A hot dish made by cooking meat and vegetables slowly in liquid for a long time.

example: I like |cheese| on pizza the best.
example_translation: ピザに乗ってるチーズが一番大好きだよ。

json.english_meaning: A solid food made from milk that is often yellow or white and can have a soft or hard texture.

example_translation: 歯医者で折れた歯を治してもらった。

other_examples.english: I learned a lot about dental care during my visit to the |dentist|.
other_examples.translation: 歯医者に行ったとき、歯のケアについてたくさん学びました。

json.english_meaning: A person who works to take care of and fix people's teeth.

example_translation: 私は朝食にパンケーキを食べるのが大好きだ。

json.english_meaning: A thin, flat, round cake made from flour, milk, and eggs, cooked on a flat pan and usually eaten hot.

example_translation: チケットの価格が上がった。

other_examples.english: The |price| of the smartphone is too high for many people.
other_examples.translation: そのスマートフォンの価格は多くの人にとって高すぎる。

derivatives.translation: 値段がつけられないほど貴重な

json.english_meaning: An amount of money that must be paid to buy something or the cost of goods and services. It can also refer to the value assigned to something in financial terms.

example_translation: 私たちの村は小さいけれど美しい。

json.english_meaning: A small community or settlement located in the countryside, typically smaller than a town.

example_translation: インドの首都はどこですか？

other_examples.english: |India| is known for its rich culture and history.
other_examples.translation: インドはその豊かな文化と歴史で知られています。

json.english_meaning: A large country located in southern Asia, known for its diverse culture and history. It has a population of over 1.2 billion people and its capital is New Delhi. The country was under British rule for nearly 200 years and gained independence in 1947. It is the largest democracy in the world, with Hindi and English as its official languages. The majority of the population practices Hinduism, but there are also significant communities of Muslims and Sikhs. India has a rich cultural connection with the UK, influencing each other's traditions and cuisine.

example_translation: 道は長く、曲がりくねっていた。

other_examples.english: The children played safely on the side of the |road|.
other_examples.translation: 子供たちは道路の脇で安全に遊んでいた。

synonyms.description: 「road」と「way」は共に「道」という意味を持つが、前者は主に車両が通行するための舗装された道を指し、後者は一般的に進む方向や方法、または特定の目的地に至るための経路を指す。

json.english_meaning: A surface made for vehicles like cars and buses to travel on, often found in addresses.

example_translation: 学校用に新しい靴下が必要なんだ。

json.english_meaning: A piece of clothing worn on the feet, usually made of soft material, that covers the foot and part of the leg.

example: We |visited| my grandparents the other day.
example_translation: この間、祖父母を訪ねました。

other_examples.english: I plan to |visit| my friend in Tokyo next month.
other_examples.translation: 来月、東京の友達を訪ねる予定です。

json.english_meaning: To go to a place or meet someone to spend time together, often for enjoyment or to learn something. This can also include going to see a professional for help or advice.

example_translation: 彼は窓を壊した。

other_examples.english: The children |broke| the toy while playing.
other_examples.translation: 子供たちは遊んでいるうちにおもちゃを壊してしまった。

phrases.translation: 法律を犯す, 違法行為をする

json.english_meaning: To cause something to separate into two or more pieces, often by hitting, dropping, or bending it; to damage something so that it no longer works properly; to fail to follow a rule or agreement; to stop something from continuing; to make someone feel defeated or unable to continue.

example: He decided what to order from the |menu|.
example_translation: 彼はメニューから何を頼むかを決めた。

other_examples.english: Could you please show me the |menu|?
other_examples.translation: メニューを見せていただけますか？

json.english_meaning: A list of all the food options available for a meal, especially in a restaurant, or a list on a computer screen that shows choices you can select to perform specific tasks.

example_translation: その競争はとても興奮した。

other_examples.english: Over a hundred runners will participate in the |race| this weekend.
other_examples.translation: 今週末、100人以上のランナーがそのレースに参加します。

phrases.translation: 競走で1位[2位, びり]になる

json.english_meaning: A competition where individuals or animals try to be the fastest to reach a finish line; a group of people who share similar physical characteristics; a situation where one group competes to achieve something before another; an event where participants strive to win a prize or gain power.

example_translation: 登山者たちはあっという間に頂上に到着した。

phrases.english: work your way to the |top| (of something)
phrases.translation: (〈組織など〉の)トップに上り詰める

synonyms.description: 「top」と「summit」は共に「頂上」という意味を持つが、前者は一般的な位置や状態の最上部を指し、後者は特に山や高い場所の最も高い点を指すことが多い。

json.english_meaning: The highest point or part of something, often considered the most important or successful position.

example_translation: 彼女は学校のために子供たちを起こしました。

other_examples.english: I |woke| up to the sound of birds singing.
other_examples.translation: 鳥の歌声で目が覚めた。

phrases.translation: 目を覚まして〜に気づく

json.english_meaning: To stop sleeping or to cause someone to stop sleeping.

example_translation: 昨年の夏、ある農場を訪れた。

other_examples.english: They own a small |farm| in the countryside.
other_examples.translation: 彼らは田舎に小さな農場を持っている。

json.english_meaning: A piece of land used for growing plants or raising animals, often as a business, and may include a house where the person who manages it lives.

example_translation: 私は昨夜、ミュージカルを観たんだ。

other_examples.english: She performed in a |musical| at her school last year.
other_examples.translation: 彼女は昨年、学校のミュージカルで演技をした。

json.english_meaning: A type of play or film that features singing and dancing, often telling a story through music.

example_translation: ふたりは私に『こんにちは』と言った。

phrases.translation: (〈要求・申し出など〉に対して)だめだと言う, (〈要求・申し出など〉を)断る
(〈要求・申し出など〉に対して)いいと言う, (〈要求・申し出など〉に)同意する, (〈要求・申し出など〉を)承諾する

json.english_meaning: To express thoughts, feelings, or ideas using words; to provide information through written or spoken language; to indicate what someone means or believes; to reveal someone's true feelings or thoughts, often without words; to articulate words from a text, such as a play or poem; to pronounce a word or sound; to suggest or propose something that may happen or be true; to draw attention or express surprise in order to communicate something.

example: There is a |university| in our town.
example_translation: 私たちの町には大学がある。

synonyms.description: 「university」と「college」は共に「大学」という意味を持つが、大学は通常、学士号や修士号、博士号を授与する高等教育機関であり、広範な学問分野を提供するのに対し、カレッジは主に学士号を授与し、特定の専門分野に焦点を当てた教育を行うことが多い。

json.english_meaning: A place of higher education where students learn and earn degrees.

example_translation: 木々の間を風が吹き抜けた。

phrases.translation: 風が〜を吹き飛ばす[舞い散らす]

json.english_meaning: Moving air, especially when it is strong or fast.

example_translation: 毎日カレンダーをチェックしている。

json.english_meaning: A collection of pages that display the days, weeks, and months of a specific year, often used to plan and organize events or tasks. It can be a wall hanging or a book with spaces for each day where you can write down important activities or appointments.

example: She wants to |join| the tennis club.
example_translation: 彼女はテニスクラブに入りたがっている。

phrases.translation: 〈人・国など〉と協力して〜する

json.english_meaning: To become part of a group or organization, to participate in an activity with others, to connect or fasten things together, or to come together at a specific point.

example_translation: 私からの贈り物を受け取ってください。

other_examples.english: I |received| a package from my grandmother yesterday.
other_examples.translation: 昨日、祖母から荷物を受け取った。

json.english_meaning: To be given something, such as a letter or message, or to get something that someone has sent. It can also mean to accept someone as a guest or member of a group.

example_translation: 彼は病気で休養が必要なんだ。

other_examples.english: She felt |sick| after eating too much candy.
other_examples.translation: 彼女はキャンディを食べ過ぎた後、気分が悪くなった。

phrases.translation: 病気で欠勤する, 病欠する

synonyms.description: 「sick」と「afflicted」は共に「病気の」という意味を持つが、前者は一般的に体調不良や病気全般を指し、後者は特定の病気や苦痛に苦しんでいる状態を強調するニュアンスがある。

json.english_meaning: Having a disease or feeling unwell; not in good health.

example_translation: 私は駅に着く。

json.english_meaning: To reach a destination or location; to come to a place where you intend to go; to be delivered or brought to you; to begin to exist or be used.

example_translation: 新しい服を買うのが好きなんだ。

synonyms.description: 「clothes」と「apparel」は共に「衣服」という意味を持つが、前者は一般的な衣服全般を指し、後者は特にファッション性やスタイルを強調した衣服を指すことが多い。

json.english_meaning: Items that people wear to cover their bodies or stay warm.

example_translation: 今日は熱があるんだ。

synonyms.description: 「fever」と「heat」は共に「熱」という意味を持つが、前者は主に病気による体温の上昇を指し、後者は一般的な温度や熱さを表す。

json.english_meaning: A medical condition where the body temperature is higher than normal, often indicating illness. It can also refer to a state of strong excitement or enthusiasm among many people.

example_translation: 販売は明日の正午から始まる。

phrases.translation: 売り損なう, 取引をふいにする
販売[売却]する, 売る

json.english_meaning: The act of exchanging goods or services for money, often at a lower price than usual, or a specific time when items are offered for purchase at reduced prices.

example_translation: 彼女は話すことが得意だ。

other_examples.english: I need to prepare a |speech| for the school event next week.
other_examples.translation: 来週の学校行事のためにスピーチを準備しなければならない。

derivatives.translation: 話す人, スピーカー
言葉を失った, 無言の
言葉では表現できない, 言葉にできない

json.english_meaning: A talk given to a group of people about a specific topic, the ability to communicate using spoken words, or the style in which someone expresses themselves verbally.

example: His |arm| got injured during the game.
example_translation: 彼は試合中に腕を負傷した。

json.english_meaning: One of the two long parts of the body that extends from the shoulders to the hands, used for various activities like lifting and holding. It can also refer to the part of a chair or sofa where you rest your arm.

example: A cat is lying down in the |corner|.
example_translation: 猫は隅で横になっている。

other_examples.english: The cat is hiding in the |corner| of the room.
other_examples.translation: その猫は部屋の隅に隠れている。

synonyms.description: 「corner」と「horn」は共に「角」という意味を持つが、前者は物体の隅や交差点の角を指し、後者は動物の角や楽器の一部を指すため、使用される文脈が異なる。

json.english_meaning: A place where two lines or edges meet, such as where two roads intersect or where two walls come together in a room. It can also refer to a difficult situation that is hard to escape from.

example_translation: 湖はとても美しい。

other_examples.english: We had a picnic by the |lake|.
other_examples.translation: 私たちは湖のそばでピクニックをした。

json.english_meaning: A large body of water that is surrounded by land.

example: The parent took their eyes off for a |moment|.
example_translation: 親はちょっとの間目を離した。

json.english_meaning: A very short period of time or a specific point in time when something happens.

example_translation: 昨日は二度と戻ってこない。

other_examples.english: What did you eat |yesterday|?
other_examples.translation: きのう何を食べましたか。

json.english_meaning: The day that comes before today; the most recent past day.

example: |Change| your shoes before entering the house.
example_translation: 家に入る前に靴を履き替えて。

derivatives.translation: 変えられる, 変更可能な

phrases.translation: 劇的[急激, 根本的]に変わる

synonyms.description: 「change」と「alter」は共に「〜を変える」という意味を持つが、前者は全体的または根本的な変化を示すことが多く、後者は特定の部分や要素を修正するニュアンスが強い。

json.english_meaning: To make something different or to become different; to stop using one thing and start using another; to replace something old or damaged with something new; to switch clothes or items for different ones; to exchange something for a different version, especially if there is a problem with it.

example_translation: 雲が羊に見える。

other_examples.english: The sky was filled with fluffy white |clouds|.
other_examples.translation: 空はふわふわした白い雲でいっぱいだった。

phrases.translation: もうもうと立ち込めるほこり[煙, ガス]

json.english_meaning: A white or gray mass in the sky made of tiny water droplets, which can also refer to a collection of dust, smoke, or insects in the air. It can symbolize feelings of fear, worry, or sadness, and can make things less clear or more difficult to see.

example_translation: 両親は私をとても愛してくれている。

other_examples.english: Young birds learn from their |parents|.
other_examples.translation: 若い鳥は親から学びます。

json.english_meaning: A person who has a child or an animal; someone who takes care of and helps a child grow and learn; a company that owns another smaller company.

example_translation: 質問があります。
